title: Consumer-lending fintechs report surging numbers in FY24; slowdown emerging in current fiscal
description: Fintech firms in consumer lending such as Navi, Kreditbee, Moneyview, and Fibe reported strong profits and revenue growth in the last financial year, recovering from Covid-related challenges.
content: The hypergrowth in the consumer lending sector had a rub off effect on the fintech firms operating in this space, with most of them reporting strong profits and a surge in revenue.The likes of Navi, Kreditbee, Moneyview and Fibe (previously EarlySalary) have reported net profits in the last financial year, data filed with rating agencies show. This after most of these platforms managed to get back on track in financial year 2023 after the challenging Covid years.Strong growth last yearSachin Bansal-promoted Navi, which was denied a banking licence by the Reserve Bank of India, built assets under management (AUM) of Rs 10,190 crore just in the personal loan business by March 2024. It started offering these loans in 2020.Along with the growth in its books, Navi also reported strong financials with a net profit of Rs 669 crore on total operating income of Rs 2,614 crore in FY24. Around Rs 552 crore of profit was from the sale of its microfinance business to Svatantra Microfin.
